description: Apply online for student finance - online applications for student finance including Tuition Fee Loans, Maintenance Loans and Grants.

details.introductory_paragraph:
If you normally live in England, you can apply online for student finance for 2024 to 2025 now.

You can apply for:

  • Tuition Fee Loans
  • Maintenance Loans
  • Maintenance Grants (only if your course started before 1 August 2016)

You can apply up to 9 months after the start of the academic year for your course.

If you’re eligible for tuition fee-only funding, you must apply by post. You can use the form finder to find and download your form.

If you need help with a further education course at a college or training provider you may be able to apply for an Advanced Learner Loan instead.

The application process is different for students from Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Check how to:

  • apply for student finance in Scotland
  • apply for student finance in Wales
  • apply for student finance in Northern Ireland
details.what_you_need_to_know:
If you cannot use a computer without help but want to apply online, you can contact Student Finance England for help.

Apply by post

It’s best to apply online. If you cannot, use the form finder to download the application forms and guidance notes you’ll need.

Problems logging in

You can:

  • recover your email address or Customer Reference Number (CRN)
  • reset your password

Student finance

contents: @{href=/student-finance/who-qualifies; text=Check if you're eligible for student finance}

contents.text: There’s a different process if you’re a student from:

steps.title: Check if you're eligible

contents.text: Find out the maximum tuition fee and maintenance loan you could get if you're a:
How much maintenance loan you get depends on where you'll study and your household income.

contents: @{href=/student-finance-calculator; text=Use the student finance calculator to estimate your maintenance loan}

contents.text: You'll have to pay back any loan you get.

contents: @{href=/repaying-your-student-loan/what-you-pay; text=Find out how much you'll repay}
@{href=/repaying-your-student-loan/when-you-start-repaying; text=Find out when you'll start repaying}

steps.title: Find out how much loan you could get

contents.text: You might be able to get extra money if you:

contents: @{href=https://www.standalone.org.uk/guides/student-guide/; text=are under 25, have no contact with your parents and support yourself}
@{href=/parents-learning-allowance; text=are a full-time student with children}
@{href=/adult-dependants-grant; text=have an adult who depends on you financially}
@{href=/disabled-students-allowances-dsas; text=have a disability, mental or physical health problem or learning difficulty like dyslexia}

contents.text: You might also be able to get other financial help, for example from your university or the government.

steps.title: Check if you can get extra help

contents: @{href=/apply-for-student-finance/household-income; text=Check if you need to give proof of your household income}

steps.title: Prepare your application

contents.text: If you're eligible for Tuition Fee Loans, Maintenance Loans, or Maintenance Grants, you can apply online.
You'll need to create a student finance account if you're a new student or sign into an existing account if you're a returning student.
It can take up to 6 weeks to process your application. You might have to provide extra evidence.

steps.title: Apply online

contents.text: If you’re eligible for tuition fee-only funding, you must complete a form and send it by post instead. You cannot apply online.
You can also apply by post if you're unable to apply online.
It can take up to 6 weeks to process your application. You might have to provide extra evidence.

steps.title: Apply by post

contents.text: You must update your application if your circumstances change. For example if you:

contents: @{text=change where you're going to live - for example with your parents instead of halls}
@{href=/apply-for-student-finance/change-an-application; text=Find out how to update your application}

steps.title: Update your details if your circumstances change

contents.text: After you register at your university or college you'll usually get your maintenance loan paid directly into your bank account at the start of each term.
Use your student finance account to:

contents: @{text=update your bank details - for example if you open a student account}
@{href=/student-finance-register-login; text=Sign in to your student finance account}

steps.title: Make sure you can be paid

contents.text: You'll need to reapply for student finance for each year of your course.
You must keep your details up to date throughout your course because some changes can affect your loan payments, for example if your household income or bank details change.

contents: @{href=/apply-for-student-finance/change-an-application; text=Check how to update your details}
@{href=/student-finance-if-you-suspend-or-leave; text=Find out what to do if you suspend or leave your course}

steps.title: Check what to do while you're studying

contents.text: When you stop studying the Student Loans Company (SLC) will create a student loans repayment account for you.
The log in details will be the same as for your student finance account. You should check your contact details are correct.

contents: @{href=/sign-in-to-manage-your-student-loan-balance; text=Sign in to your student loan repayment account}

contents.text: You must update your employment details if:

contents: @{text=you leave the UK for more than 3 months}

steps.title: Check what to do when you stop studying

contents.text: The repayment plan you're on will determine when you start repaying and how much you repay.

contents: @{href=/repaying-your-student-loan/which-repayment-plan-you-are-on; text=Check which repayment plan you’re on}
@{href=/repaying-your-student-loan/what-you-pay; text=Find out how much you'll repay}
@{href=/repaying-your-student-loan/when-you-start-repaying; text=Find out when you'll start repaying}

steps.title: Repay your loan
